org.jboss.windup.graph.traversal

Interface TraversalStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AllTraversalStrategy, OnlyOnceTraversalStrategy, SharedLibsTraversalStrategy

    public interface TraversalStrategy
    Allows for pluggable implementations of the ProjectModelTraversal.getChildren() method. See also the AllTraversalStrategy, OnlyOnceTraversalStrategy, SharedLibsTraversalStrategy.
    Author:
    Jesse Sightler, Ondrej Zizka, zizka@seznam.cz

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Iterable<ProjectModelTraversal> getChildren(ProjectModelTraversal traversal)
      Returns the child projects of the current project in the traversal.
      ProjectModelTraversal.TraversalState getTraversalState(ProjectModelTraversal traversal)
      Calculates a traversal state for the given ProjectModelTraversal.
      void reset()
      Resets the state of this strategy, so it can be reused.

    • Method Detail

      • getTraversalState

        ProjectModelTraversal.TraversalState getTraversalState(ProjectModelTraversal traversal)
        Calculates a traversal state for the given ProjectModelTraversal. This can be used to indicate to a client that it should skip a particular node.

      • getChildren

        Iterable<ProjectModelTraversal> getChildren(ProjectModelTraversal traversal)
        Returns the child projects of the current project in the traversal.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the state of this strategy, so it can be reused. For instance, if the strategy is keeping some intermediate data like a set of visited projects etc.
